questions.subject: chemistry
questions.content: The addition of dilute NaOH to Cr<sup>3+</sup> salt solution will give :
questions.explanation:
$$C{r^{3 + }} + \mathop {NaOH}\limits_{dil.} \buildrel {} \over
 \longrightarrow \mathop {C{r_2}{O_3}.{{({H_2}O)}_n}}\limits_{precipitate} $$

questions.subject: chemistry
questions.content:
Given below are two statements :

Statement I : Ethyl pent-4-yn-oate on reaction with CH3MgBr gives a 3$$^\circ$$-alcohol.

Statement II : In this reaction one mole of ethyl pent-4-yn-oate utilizes two moles of CH3MgBr.

In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :

options.content: Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
Both Statement I and Statement II are true.

questions.explanation:
Statement I is true

But it consume 3 moles of CH3MgBr.

So Statement II is false.

questions.subject: chemistry
questions.content: The compound/s which will show significant intermolecular H-bonding is/are :
questions.explanation:
(a) Shows intra molecular H-bonding

(b) Shows significant intermolecular H-bonding

(c) It do not show intermolecular H-bonding due to steric hindrance.

questions.subject: chemistry
questions.content: Which one of the following reactions will not yield propionic acid?
questions.explanation: All gives propanoic acid as product but option (d) gives butanoic as product

questions.subject: chemistry
questions.content: The correct order of ionic radii for the ions, P<sup>3$$-$$</sup>, S<sup>2$$-$$</sup>, Ca<sup>2+</sup>, K<sup>+</sup>, Cl<sup>$$-$$</sup> is :
questions.explanation:
P3$$-$$ > S2$$-$$ > Cl$$-$$ > K+ > Ca2+ (Correct order of ionic radii)

all the given species are isoelectronic species. In isoelectronic species size increases with increase of negative charge and size decreases with increase in positive charge.

questions.content: Potassium permanganate on heating at 513 K gives a product which is :
questions.explanation:
$$2KMn{O_4}\mathrel{\mathop{\kern0pt\longrightarrow} \limits_{200^\circ C}^\Delta } \mathop {{K_2}Mn{O_4}}\limits_{Green} + \mathop {Mn{O_2}}\limits_{Black} + {O_2}$$

In K2MnO4, manganese oxidation state is +6 and hence it has one unpaired e$$-$$.

questions.subject: chemistry
questions.content: Which one of the following tests used for the identification of functional groups in organic compounds does not use copper reagent?
questions.explanation:
In Seliwanoff's reagent, Cu is not present.

In Barfoed, Biuret and in Benediet reagent Cu is present.

questions.subject: chemistry
questions.content: Hydrolysis of sucrose gives :
questions.explanation:
Sucrose is formed by $$\alpha$$-D(+). Glucose + $$\beta$$-D($$-$$) Fructose.

We obtain these monomers on hydrolysis.

questions.content: The correct structures of A and B formed in the following reactions are :

questions.subject: chemistry
questions.content:
The first order rate constant for the decomposition of CaCO3 at 700 K is 6.36 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$3s$$-$$1 and activation energy is 209 kJ mol$$-$$1. Its rate constant (in s$$-$$1) at 600 K is x $$\times$$ 10$$-$$6. The value of x is ___________. (Nearest integer)

[Given R = 8.31 J K$$-$$ mol$$-$$1; log 6.36 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$3 = $$-$$2.19, 10$$-$$4.79 = 1.62 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$5]

questions.subject: chemistry
questions.content: The number of optical isomers possible for [Cr(C<sub>2</sub>O<sub>4</sub>)<sub>3</sub>]<sup>3$$-$$</sup> is ____________.
questions.explanation: The number of optical isomers for [Cr(C2O4)3]3$$-$$ is two.

questions.subject: chemistry
questions.content:
Two flasks I and II shown below are connected by a valve of negligible volume.


When the valve is opened, the final pressure of the system in bar is x $$\times$$ 10$$-$$2. The value of x is __________. (Integer answer)

[Assume - Ideal gas; 1 bar = 105 Pa; Molar mass of N2 = 28.0 g mol$$-$$1; R = 8.31 J mol$$-$$1 K$$-$$1]

questions.subject: chemistry
questions.content:
100 g of propane is completely reacted with 1000 g of oxygen. The mole fraction of carbon dioxide in the resulting mixture is x $$\times$$ 10$$-$$2. The value of x is ____________. (Nearest integer)

[Atomic weight : H = 1.008; C = 12.00; O = 16.00]
questions.explanation:
C3H8(g) + 5O2(g) $$\to$$ 3CO2(g) + 4H2O(l)

t = 0 2.27 mole 31.25 mol
t = $$\infty $$ 0 19.9 mol 6.81 mol 9.08 mol


mole fraction of CO2 in the final reaction mixture (heterogenous)

$${X_{C{O_2}}} = {{6.81} \over {19.9 + 6.81 + 9.08}}$$

= 0.1902 = 19.02 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$2

$$\Rightarrow$$ 19

questions.subject: chemistry
questions.content: 40 g of glucose (Molar mass = 180) is mixed with 200 mL of water. The freezing point of solution is __________ K. (Nearest integer) [Given : K<sub>f</sub> = 1.86 K kg mol<sup>$$-$$1</sup>; Density of water = 1.00 g cm<sup>$$-$$3</sup>; Freezing point of water = 273.15 K]
questions.explanation:
Molality = $${{\left( {{{40} \over {180}}} \right)mol} \over {0.2\,Kg}} = \left( {{{10} \over 9}} \right)$$ molal

$$ \Rightarrow \Delta {T_f} = {T_f} - {T_f}' = 1.86 \times {{10} \over 9}$$

$$ \Rightarrow {T_f}' = 273.15 - 1.86 \times {{10} \over 9}$$

= 271.08 K

$$ \simeq $$ 271 K (nearest - integer)

questions.subject: chemistry
questions.content: The resistance of a conductivity cell with cell constant 1.14 cm<sup>$$-$$1</sup>, containing 0.001 M KCl at 298 K is 1500 $$\Omega$$. The molar conductivity of 0.001 M KCl solution at 298 K in S cm<sup>2</sup> mol<sup>$$-$$1</sup> is ____________. (Integer answer)
questions.explanation:
$$K = {1 \over R} \times {l \over A} = \left( {\left( {{1 \over {1500}}} \right) \times 1.14} \right)$$ S cm$$-$$1

$$ \Rightarrow { \wedge _m} = 1000 \times {{\left( {{{1.14} \over {1500}}} \right)} \over {0.001}}$$ S cm2 mol$$-$$1

= 760 S cm2 mol$$-$$1

$$\Rightarrow$$ 760

questions.subject: chemistry
questions.content:
The number of photons emitted by a monochromatic (single frequency) infrared range finder of power 1 mW and wavelength of 1000 nm, in 0.1 second is x $$\times$$ 1013. The value of x is _____________. (Nearest integer)

(h = 6.63 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$34 Js, c = 3.00 $$\times$$ 108 ms$$-$$1)
questions.explanation:
Energy emitted in 0.1 sec.

= 0.1 sec. $$\times$$ $${10^{ - 3}}{J \over s}$$

= 10$$-$$4 J

If 'n' photons of $$\lambda$$ = 1000 nm are emitted, then 10$$-$$4 = n $$\times$$ $${{hc} \over \lambda }$$

$$ \Rightarrow {10^{ - 4}} = {{n \times 6.63 \times {{10}^{ - 34}} \times 3 \times {{10}^8}} \over {1000 \times {{10}^{ - 9}}}}$$

$$\Rightarrow$$ n = 5.02 $$\times$$ 1014 = 50.2 $$\times$$ 1013

$$\Rightarrow$$ 50 (nearest integer)

questions.subject: chemistry
questions.content: When 5.1 g of solid NH<sub>4</sub>HS is introduced into a two litre evacuated flask at 27$$^\circ$$C, 20% of the solid decomposes into gaseous ammonia and hydrogen sulphide. The K<sub>p</sub> for the reaction at 27$$^\circ$$C is x $$\times$$ 10<sup>$$-$$2</sup>. The value of x is _____________. (Integer answer) [Given R = 0.082 L atm K<sup>$$-$$1</sup> mol<sup>$$-$$</sup>]
questions.explanation:
moles of NH4HS initially taken = $${{5.1g} \over {51g/mol}}$$ = 0.1 mol

volume of vessel = 2 litre



$$\Rightarrow$$ partial pressure of each component

$$P = {{nRT} \over V} = {{0.1 \times 0.2 \times 0.082 \times 300} \over 2}$$

= 0.246 atm

$$\Rightarrow$$ kP = P$$N{H_3}$$ $$\times$$ P$${H_2}S$$ = (0.246)2 = 0.060516

= 6.05 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$2

$$ \therefore $$ x = 6

questions.subject: chemistry
questions.content:
The number of species having non-pyramidal shape among the following is ___________.

(A) SO3

(B) NO$$_3^ - $$

(C) PCl3

(D) CO$$_3^{2 - }$$
questions.explanation: Hence, non-pyramidal species are SO3, NO$$_3^{- }$$ and CO$$_3^{2 - }$$.

questions.subject: chemistry
questions.content:
Data given for the following reaction is as follows :

FeO(s) + C(graphite) $$\to$$ Fe(s) + CO(g)

Substance $$\Delta H^\circ $$
(kJ mol$$^{ - 1}$$)		 $$\Delta S^\circ $$
(J mol$$^{ - 1}$$ K$$^{ - 1}$$)
$$Fe{O_{(s)}}$$ $$ - 266.3$$ 57.49
$${C_{(graphite)}}$$ 0 5.74
$$F{e_{(s)}}$$ 0 27.28
$$C{O_{(g)}}$$ $$ - 110.5$$ 197.6


The minimum temperature in K at which the reaction becomes spontaneous is ___________. (Integer answer)
questions.explanation:
$${T_{\min }} = \left( {{{{\Delta ^0}H} \over {{\Delta ^0}S}}} \right)$$

$${\Delta ^0}{H_{rxn}} = \left[ {\Delta _f^0H(Fe) + \Delta _f^0H(CO)} \right] - $$

$$ = \left[ {\Delta _f^0H(FeO) + \Delta _f^0H({C_{(graphite)}})} \right]$$

$$ = [0 - 110.5] - [ - 266.3 + 0]$$

= 155.8 kJ/mol

$${\Delta ^0}{S_{rxn}} = \left[ {{\Delta ^0}S(Fe) + {\Delta ^0}S(CO)} \right] - $$

$$\left[ {{\Delta ^0}S(FeO) + {\Delta ^0}S({C_{(graphite)}})} \right]$$

$$ = [27.28 + 197.6] - [57.49 + 5.74]$$

= 161.65 J/mol-K

$${T_{\min }} = {{155.8 \times {{10}^3}J/mol} \over {161.65J/mol - K}} = 963.8$$ K

$$ \simeq 964$$ k (nearest integer)

questions.subject: mathematics
questions.content: The angle between the straight lines, whose direction cosines are given by the equations 2l + 2m $$-$$ n = 0 and mn + nl + lm = 0, is :
questions.explanation:
n = 2 (l + m)

lm + n(l + m) = 0

lm + 2(l + m)2 = 0

2l2 + 2m2 + 5ml = 0

$$2{\left( {{l \over m}} \right)^2} + 2 + 5\left( {{l \over m}} \right) = 0$$

2t2 + 5t + 2 = 0

(t + 2)(2t + 1) = 0

$$ \Rightarrow t = - 2; - {1 \over 2}$$

(i) $${l \over m} = - 2$$

$${n \over m} = - 2$$

($$-$$2m, m, $$-$$2m)

($$-$$2, 1, $$-$$2)

(ii) $${l \over m} = - {1 \over 2}$$

n = $$-$$2l

(l, $$-$$2l, $$-$$2l)

(1, $$-$$2, $$-$$2)

$$\cos \theta = {{ - 2 - 2 + 4} \over {\sqrt 9 \sqrt 9 }} = 0 \Rightarrow 0 = {\pi \over 2}$$

questions.subject: mathematics
mathematics
questions.content:
Let M and m respectively be the maximum and minimum values of the function
f(x) = tan$$-$$1 (sin x + cos x) in $$\left[ {0,{\pi \over 2}} \right]$$, then the value of tan(M $$-$$ m) is equal to :
questions.explanation:
Let g(x) = sin x + cos x = $$\sqrt 2 $$ sin$$\left( {x + {\pi \over 4}} \right)$$

g(x)$$\in$$ $$\left[ {1,\sqrt 2 } \right]$$ for x$$\in$$ [0, $$\pi$$/2]

f(x) = tan$$-$$1 (sin x + cos x) $$\in$$ $$\left[ {{\pi \over 4},{{\tan }^{ - 1}}\sqrt 2 } \right]$$

tan$$({\tan ^{ - 1}}\sqrt 2 - {\pi \over 4}) = {{\sqrt 2 - 1} \over {1 + \sqrt 2 }} \times {{\sqrt 2 - 1} \over {\sqrt 2 - 1}} = 3 - 2\sqrt 2 $$

questions.subject: mathematics
questions.content:
If two tangents drawn from a point P to the
parabola y2 = 16(x $$-$$ 3) are at right angles, then the locus of point P is :
questions.explanation:
Locus is directrix of parabola

x $$-$$ 3 + 4 = 0 $$\Rightarrow$$ x + 1 = 0.

questions.subject: mathematics
questions.content: If the solution curve of the differential equation (2x $$-$$ 10y<sup>3</sup>)dy + ydx = 0, passes through the points (0, 1) and (2, $$\beta$$), then $$\beta$$ is a root of the equation :
questions.explanation:
$$(2x - 10{y^3})dy + ydx = 0$$

$$ \Rightarrow {{dx} \over {dy}} + \left( {{2 \over y}} \right)x = 10{y^2}$$

$$I.F. = {e^{\int {{2 \over y}dy} }} = {e^{2\ln (y)}} = {y^2}$$

Solution of D.E. is

$$\therefore$$ $$x\,.\,y = \int {(10{y^2}){y^2}.\,dy} $$

$$x{y^2} = {{10{y^5}} \over 5} + C \Rightarrow x{y^2} = 2{y^5} + C$$

It passes through (0, 1) $$\to$$ 0 = 2 + C $$\Rightarrow$$ C = $$-$$2

$$\therefore$$ Curve is $$x{y^2} = 2{y^5} - 2$$

Now, it passes through (2, $$\beta$$)

$$2{\beta ^2} = 2{\beta ^5} - 2 \Rightarrow {\beta ^5} - {\beta ^2} - 1 = 0$$

$$\therefore$$ $$\beta$$ is root of an equation $${y^5} - {y^2} - 1 = 0$$

questions.subject: mathematics
questions.content:
Let [$$\lambda$$] be the greatest integer less than or equal to $$\lambda$$. The set of all values of $$\lambda$$ for which the system of linear equations
x + y + z = 4,
3x + 2y + 5z = 3,
9x + 4y + (28 + [$$\lambda$$])z = [$$\lambda$$] has a solution is :

questions.subject: mathematics
questions.content: The set of all values of K > $$-$$1, for which the equation $${(3{x^2} + 4x + 3)^2} - (k + 1)(3{x^2} + 4x + 3)(3{x^2} + 4x + 2) + k{(3{x^2} + 4x + 2)^2} = 0$$ has real roots, is :
questions.explanation:
$${(3{x^2} + 4x + 3)^2} - (k + 1)(3{x^2} + 4x + 3)(3{x^2} + 4x + 2) + k{(3{x^2} + 4x + 2)^2} = 0$$

Let $$3{x^2} + 4x + 3 = a$$

and $$3{x^2} + 4x + 2 = b \Rightarrow b = a - 1$$

Given equation becomes

$$ \Rightarrow {a^2} - (k + 1)ab + k{b^2} = 0$$

$$ \Rightarrow a(a - kb) - b(a - kb) = 0$$

$$ \Rightarrow (a - kb)(a - b) = 0 \Rightarrow a = kb$$ or a = b (reject) $$\because$$ a = kb

$$ \Rightarrow 3{x^2} + 4x + 3 = k(3{x^2} + 4x + 2)$$

$$ \Rightarrow 3(k - 1){x^2} + 4(k - 1)x + (2k - 3) = 0$$ for real roots

D $$\ge$$ 0

$$ \Rightarrow 16{(k - 1)^2} - 4(3(k - 1))(2k - 3) \ge 0$$

$$ \Rightarrow 4(k - 1)\{ 4(k - 1) - 3(2k - 3)\} \ge 0$$

$$ \Rightarrow 4(k - 1)\{ - 2k + 5\} \ge 0$$

$$ \Rightarrow - 4(k - 1)\{ 2k - 5\} \ge 0$$

$$ \Rightarrow (k - 1)(2k - 5) \le 0$$



$$\therefore$$ $$k \in \left[ {1,{5 \over 2}} \right]$$

$$\therefore$$ $$k \ne 1$$

$$\therefore$$ $$k \in \left( {1,{5 \over 2}} \right]$$

questions.subject: mathematics
questions.content: A box open from top is made from a rectangular sheet of dimension a $$\times$$ b by cutting squares each of side x from each of the four corners and folding up the flaps. If the volume of the box is maximum, then x is equal to :
questions.explanation:
V = l . b . h = (a $$-$$ 2x)(b $$-$$ 2x) x

$$\Rightarrow$$ V(x) = (2x $$-$$ a)(2x $$-$$ b) x

$$\Rightarrow$$ V(x) = 4x3 $$-$$ 2(a + b)x2 + abx

$$ \Rightarrow {d \over {dx}}v(x) = 12{x^2} - 4(a + b)x + ab$$

$${d \over {dx}}(v(x)) = 0 \Rightarrow 12{x^2} - 4(a + b)x + ab = 0 < _\beta ^\alpha $$

$$ \Rightarrow x = {{4(a + b) \pm \sqrt {16{{(a + b)}^2} - 48ab} } \over {2(12)}}$$

$$ = {{(a + b) \pm \sqrt {{a^2} + {b^2} - ab} } \over 6}$$

Let $$x = \alpha = {{(a + b) + \sqrt {{a^2} + {b^2} - ab} } \over 6}$$

$$\beta = {{(a + b) - \sqrt {{a^2} + {b^2} - ab} } \over 6}$$

Now, $$12(x - \alpha )(x - \beta ) = 0$$



$$\therefore$$ x = $$\beta$$ $$ = {{a + b - \sqrt {{a^2} + {b^2} - ab} } \over b}$$

questions.subject: mathematics
questions.content:
Let Z be the set of all integers,

$$A = \{ (x,y) \in Z \times Z:{(x - 2)^2} + {y^2} \le 4\} $$

$$B = \{ (x,y) \in Z \times Z:{x^2} + {y^2} \le 4\} $$

$$C = \{ (x,y) \in Z \times Z:{(x - 2)^2} + {(y - 2)^2} \le 4\} $$

If the total number of relation from A $$\cap$$ B to A $$\cap$$ C is 2p, then the value of p is :
questions.explanation:
(x $$-$$ 2)2 + y2 $$\le$$ 4

x2 + y2 $$\le$$ 4

No. of points common in C1 & C2 is 5.

(0, 0), (1, 0), (2, 0), (1, 1), (1, $$-$$1)

Similarly in C2 & C3 is 5.

No. of relations = 2$$ 5 \times 5$$ = 225.

questions.subject: mathematics
questions.content: The area of the region bounded by the parabola (y $$-$$ 2)<sup>2</sup> = (x $$-$$ 1), the tangent to it at the point whose ordinate is 3 and the x-axis is :
questions.explanation:
y = 3 $$\Rightarrow$$ x = 2

Point is (2, 3)

Diff. w.r.t x

2 (y $$-$$ 2) y' = 1

$$\Rightarrow$$ $$y' = {1 \over {2(y - 2)}}$$

$$ \Rightarrow y{'_{(2,3)}} = {1 \over 2}$$

$$ \Rightarrow {{y - 3} \over {x - 2}} = {1 \over 2} \Rightarrow x - 2y + 4 = 0$$

Area $$ = \int\limits_0^3 {\left( {{{(y - 2)}^2} + 1 - (2y - 4)} \right)} \,dy$$

= 9 sq. units

questions.subject: mathematics
questions.content: If $$y(x) = {\cot ^{ - 1}}\left( {{{\sqrt {1 + \sin x}  + \sqrt {1 - \sin x} } \over {\sqrt {1 + \sin x}  - \sqrt {1 - \sin x} }}} \right),x \in \left( {{\pi  \over 2},\pi } \right)$$, then $${{dy} \over {dx}}$$ at $$x = {{5\pi } \over 6}$$ is :
questions.explanation:
We have,

$$ y(x)=\cot ^{-1}\left(\frac{\sqrt{1+\sin x}+\sqrt{1-\sin x}}{\sqrt{1+\sin x}-\sqrt{1-\sin x}}\right) $$

$$ =\cot ^{-1} \frac{\left|\cos \frac{x}{2}+\sin \frac{x}{2}\right|+\left|\cos \frac{x}{2}-\sin \frac{x}{2}\right|}{\left|\cos \frac{x}{2}+\sin \frac{x}{2}\right|-\left|\cos \frac{x}{2}-\sin \frac{x}{2}\right|} $$

$$ \left[\text { as } \cos ^2 \frac{x}{2}+\sin ^2 \frac{x}{2}=1\right. $$

and $\left.\sin x=2 \sin \frac{x}{2} \cos \frac{x}{2}\right]$

$$ \begin{aligned} & =\cot ^{-1}\left(\frac{\cos \frac{x}{2}+\sin \frac{x}{2}+\sin \frac{x}{2}-\cos \frac{x}{2}}{\cos \frac{x}{2}+\sin \frac{x}{2}-\sin \frac{x}{2}+\cos \frac{x}{2}}\right) \forall x \in\left(\frac{\pi}{2}, \pi\right) \\ & \end{aligned} $$

$$ =\cot ^{-1}\left(\frac{\sin \frac{x}{2}}{\cos \frac{x}{2}}\right)=\cot ^{-1}\left(\tan \frac{x}{2}\right) $$

$$ =\frac{\pi}{2}-\tan ^{-1}\left(\tan \frac{x}{2}\right) $$

$$ \begin{aligned} & \therefore y^{\prime}(x)=\frac{\pi}{2}-\frac{x}{2} \\\\ & \Rightarrow \frac{d y}{d x}=y^{\prime}(x)=-\frac{1}{2}=y^{\prime}\left(\frac{5 \pi}{6}\right) \end{aligned} $$

questions.subject: mathematics
questions.content: The value of the integral $$\int\limits_0^1 {{{\sqrt x dx} \over {(1 + x)(1 + 3x)(3 + x)}}} $$ is :
questions.explanation:
$$I = \int\limits_0^1 {{{\sqrt x dx} \over {(1 + x)(1 + 3x)(3 + x)}}} dx$$

Let x = t2 $$\Rightarrow$$ dx = 2t . dt

$$I = \int\limits_0^1 {{{t(2t)} \over {({t^2} + 1)(1 + 3{t^2})(3 + {t^2})}}} dt$$

$$I = \int\limits_0^1 {{{(3{t^2} + 1) - ({t^2} + 1)} \over {(3{t^2} + 1)({t^2} + 1)(3 + {t^2})}}} dt$$

$$I = \int\limits_0^1 {{{dt} \over {({t^2} + 1)(3 + {t^2})}}} - \int\limits_0^1 {{{dt} \over {(1 + 3{t^2})(3 + {t^2})}}} $$

$$ = {1 \over 2}\int\limits_0^1 {{{(3 + {t^2}) - ({t^2} + 1)} \over {({t^2} + 1)(3 + {t^2})}}} dt + {1 \over 8}\int\limits_0^1 {{{(1 + 3{t^2}) - 3(3 + {t^2})} \over {(1 + 3{t^2})(3 + {t^2})}}} dt$$

$$ = {1 \over 2}\int\limits_0^1 {{{dt} \over {1 + {t^2}}} - {1 \over 2}\int\limits_0^1 {{{dt} \over {{t^2} + 3}} + {1 \over 8}\int\limits_0^1 {{{dt} \over {{t^2} + 3}} - {3 \over 8}\int\limits_0^1 {{{dt} \over {(1 + 3{t^2})}}} } } } $$

$$ = {1 \over 2}\int\limits_0^1 {{{dt} \over {{t^2} + 1}} - {3 \over 8}\int\limits_0^1 {{{dt} \over {{t^2} + 3}} - {3 \over 8}\int\limits_0^1 {{{dt} \over {1 + 3{t^2}}}} } } $$

$$ = {1 \over 2}({\tan ^{ - 1}}(t))_0^1 - {3 \over {8\sqrt 3 }}\left( {{{\tan }^{ - 1}}\left( {{t \over {\sqrt 3 }}} \right)} \right)_0^1 - {3 \over {8\sqrt 3 }}\left( {{{\tan }^{ - 1}}\left( {\sqrt 3 t} \right)} \right)_0^1$$

$$ = {1 \over 2}\left( {{\pi \over 4}} \right) - {{\sqrt 3 } \over 8}\left( {{\pi \over 6}} \right) - {{\sqrt 3 } \over 8}\left( {{\pi \over 3}} \right)$$

$$ = {\pi \over 8} - {{\sqrt 3 } \over {16}}\pi $$

$$ = {\pi \over 8}\left( {1 - {{\sqrt 3 } \over 2}} \right)$$

questions.subject: mathematics
questions.content: If $$\mathop {\lim }\limits_{x \to \infty } \left( {\sqrt {{x^2} - x + 1}  - ax} \right) = b$$, then the ordered pair (a, b) is :
questions.explanation:
$$\mathop {\lim }\limits_{x \to \infty } \left( {\sqrt {{x^2} - x + 1} } \right) - ax = b$$ ($$\infty$$ $$-$$ $$\infty$$)

Now, $$\mathop {\lim }\limits_{x \to \infty } {{({x^2} - x + 1 - {a^2}{x^2}}) \over {\sqrt {{x^2} - x + 1} + ax}} = b$$

$$ \Rightarrow \mathop {\lim }\limits_{x \to \infty } {{(1 - {a^2}){x^2} - x + 1} \over {\sqrt {{x^2} - x + 1} + ax}} = b$$

$$ \Rightarrow \mathop {\lim }\limits_{x \to \infty } {{(1 - {a^2}){x^2} - x + 1} \over {x\left( {\sqrt {1 - {1 \over x} + {1 \over {{x^2}}}} + a} \right)}} = b$$

$$ \Rightarrow 1 - {a^2} = 0 \Rightarrow a = 1$$

Now, $$\mathop {\lim }\limits_{x \to \infty } {{ - x + 1} \over {x\left( {\sqrt {1 - {1 \over x} + {1 \over {{x^2}}}} + a} \right)}} = b$$

$$ \Rightarrow {{ - 1} \over {1 + a}} = b \Rightarrow b = - {1 \over 2}$$

$$(a,b) = \left( {1, - {1 \over 2}} \right)$$

questions.subject: mathematics
questions.content:
The probability distribution of random variable X is given by :

X 1 2 3 4 5
P(X) K 2K 2K 3K K


Let p = P(1 < X < 4 | X < 3). If 5p = $$\lambda$$K, then $$\lambda$$ equal to ___________.
questions.explanation:
$$\sum {P(X) = 1 \Rightarrow k + 2k + 3} k + k = 1$$

$$ \Rightarrow k = {1 \over 9}$$

Now, $$p = P\left( {{{kx < 4} \over {X < 3}}} \right) = {{P(X = 2)} \over {P(X < 3)}} = {{{{2k} \over {9k}}} \over {{k \over {9k}} + {{2k} \over {9k}}}} = {2 \over 3}$$

$$ \Rightarrow p = {2 \over 3}$$

Now, $$5p = \lambda k$$

$$ \Rightarrow (5)\left( {{2 \over 3}} \right) = \lambda (1/9)$$

$$ \Rightarrow \lambda = 30$$

questions.subject: mathematics
questions.content: Let z<sub>1</sub> and z<sub>2</sub> be two complex numbers such that $$\arg ({z_1} - {z_2}) = {\pi  \over 4}$$ and z<sub>1</sub>, z<sub>2</sub> satisfy the equation | z $$-$$ 3 | = Re(z). Then the imaginary part of z<sub>1</sub> + z<sub>2</sub> is equal to ___________.

questions.subject: mathematics
questions.content: Let S = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9}. Then the number of elements in the set T = {A $$ \subseteq $$ S : A $$\ne$$ $$\phi$$ and the sum of all the elements of A is not a multiple of 3} is _______________.
questions.explanation:
3n type $$\to$$ 3, 6, 9 = P

3n $$-$$ 1 type $$\to$$ 2, 5 = Q

3n $$-$$ 2 type $$\to$$ 1, 4 = R

number of subset of S containing one element which are not divisible by 3 = $${}^2$$C1 + $${}^2$$C1 = 4

number of subset of S containing two numbers whose some is not divisible by 3

= $${}^3$$C1 $$\times$$ $${}^2$$C1 + $${}^3$$C1 $$\times$$ $${}^2$$C1 + $${}^2$$C2 + $${}^2$$C2 = 14

number of subsets containing 3 elements whose sum is not divisible by 3

= $${}^3$$C2 $$\times$$ $${}^4$$C1 + ($${}^2$$C2 $$\times$$ $${}^2$$C1)2 + $${}^3$$C1($${}^2$$C2 + $${}^2$$C2) = 22

number of subsets containing 4 elements whose sum is not divisible by 3

= $${}^3$$C3 $$\times$$ $${}^4$$C1 + $${}^3$$C2($${}^2$$C2 + $${}^2$$C2) + ($${}^3$$C1$${}^2$$C1 $$\times$$ $${}^2$$C2)2

= 4 + 6 + 12 = 22

number of subsets of S containing 5 elements whose sum is not divisible by 3.

= $${}^3$$C3($${}^2$$C2 + $${}^2$$C2) + ($${}^3$$C2$${}^2$$C1 $$\times$$ $${}^2$$C2) $$\times$$ 2 = 2 + 12 = 14

number of subsets of S containing 6 elements whose sum is not divisible by 3 = 4

$$\Rightarrow$$ Total subsets of Set A whose sum of digits is not divisible by 3 = 4 + 14 + 22 + 22 + 14 + 4 = 80.

questions.subject: mathematics
questions.content: 3 $$\times$$ 7<sup>22</sup> + 2 $$\times$$ 10<sup>22</sup> $$-$$ 44 when divided by 18 leaves the remainder __________.

questions.subject: mathematics
questions.content: An online exam is attempted by 50 candidates out of which 20 are boys. The average marks obtained by boys is 12 with a variance 2. The variance of marks obtained by 30 girls is also 2. The average marks of all 50 candidates is 15. If $$\mu$$ is the average marks of girls and $$\sigma$$<sup>2</sup> is the variance of marks of 50 candidates, then $$\mu$$ + $$\sigma$$<sup>2</sup> is equal to ________________.
questions.explanation:
$$\sigma _b^2$$ = 2 (variance of boys)

n1 = no. of boys

$${\overline x _b}$$ = 12

n2 = no. of girls

$$\sigma _g^2$$ = 2

$${\overline x _g}$$ = $${{50 \times 15 - 12 \times {\sigma _b}} \over {30}} = {{750 - 12 \times 20} \over {30}} = 17 = \mu $$

variance of combined series

$$\sigma _{}^2 = {{{n_1}\sigma _b^2 + {n_2}\sigma _g^2} \over {{n_1} + {n_2}}} + {{{n_1}.\,{n_2}} \over {{{({n_1} + {n_2})}^2}}}{\left( {{{\overline x }_b} - {{\overline x }_g}} \right)^2}$$

$$\sigma _{}^2 = {{20 \times 2 + 30 \times 2} \over {20 + 30}} + {{20 \times 30} \over {{{(20 + 30)}^2}}}{(12 - 17)^2}$$

$$\sigma$$2 = 8

$$\Rightarrow$$ $$\mu$$ + $$\sigma$$2 = 17 + 8 = 25

questions.subject: mathematics
questions.content: If $$\int {{{2{e^x} + 3{e^{ - x}}} \over {4{e^x} + 7{e^{ - x}}}}dx = {1 \over {14}}(ux + v{{\log }_e}(4{e^x} + 7{e^{ - x}})) + C} $$, where C is a constant of integration, then u + v is equal to _____________.

questions.subject: physics
questions.content: Curved surfaces of a plano-convex lens of refractive index $$\mu$$1 and a plano-concave lens of refractive index $$\mu$$2 have equal radius of curvature as shown in figure. Find the ratio of radius of curvature to the focal length of the combined lenses.
questions.explanation:
$${1 \over {{f_1}}} = ({\mu _1} - 1)\left( {{1 \over R}} \right)$$

$${1 \over {{f_2}}} = ({\mu _2} - 1)\left( {{1 \over R}} \right)$$

$${1 \over {{f_1}}} + {1 \over {{f_2}}} = {1 \over {{f_{eq}}}} = {{({\mu _1} - 1) - ({\mu _2} - 1)} \over R}$$

$${1 \over {{f_{eq}}}} = {{({\mu _1} - {\mu _2})} \over R}$$

$${R \over {{f_{eq}}}} = ({\mu _1} - {\mu _2})$$

questions.subject: physics
questions.content: The boxes of masse 2 kg and 8 kg are connected by a massless string passing over smooth pulleys. Calculate the time taken by box of mass 8 kg to strike the ground starting from rest. (use g = 10 m/s2)
questions.explanation:
(m1g $$-$$ 2T) = m1a $$-$$ (1)

T $$-$$ m2g = m2(2a)

2T $$-$$ 2m2g = 4m2 a $$-$$ (2)

m1g $$-$$ 2m2g = (m1 + 4m2) a

a = $${{(8 - 4)g} \over {(8 + 8)}} = {4 \over {16}}g = {g \over 4}$$

a = $${{10} \over 4}$$ m/s2

S = $${1 \over 2}$$ at2

$${{0.2 \times 2 \times 4} \over {10}}$$ = t2

t = 0.4 sec

questions.subject: physics
questions.content: Water drops are falling from a nozzle of a shower onto the floor, from a height of 9.8 m. The drops fall at a regular interval of time. When the first drop strikes the floor, at that instant, the third drop begins to fall. Locate the position of second drop from the floor when the first drop strikes the floor.
questions.explanation:
H = $${1 \over 2}$$gt2

$${{9.8 \times 2} \over {9.8}}$$ = t2

t = $$\sqrt 2 $$ sec

$$\Delta$$t : time interval between drops

h = $${1 \over 2}$$g($$\sqrt 2 $$ $$-$$ 2$$\Delta$$t)2

$$\Delta$$t = $${1 \over {\sqrt 2 }}$$

h = $${1 \over 2}$$g$${\left( {\sqrt 2 - {1 \over {\sqrt 2 }}} \right)^2} = {1 \over 2} \times 9.8 \times {1 \over 2} = {{9.8} \over 4} = 2.45$$ m

H $$-$$ h = 9.8 $$-$$ 2.45

= 7.35 m

questions.subject: physics
questions.content: Two discs have moments of inertia I<sub>1</sub> and I<sub>2</sub> about their respective axes perpendicular to the plane and passing through the centre. They are rotating with angular speeds, $$\omega$$<sub>1</sub> and $$\omega$$<sub>2</sub> respectively and are brought into contact face to face with their axes of rotation coaxial. The loss in kinetic energy of the system in the process is given by :
questions.explanation:
From conservation of angular momentum we get

$${I_1}{\omega _1} + {I_2}{\omega _2} = ({I_1} + {I_2})\omega $$

$$\omega = {{{I_1}{\omega _1} + {I_2}{\omega _2}} \over {{I_1} + {I_2}}}$$

$${k_i} = {1 \over 2}{I_1}\omega _1^2 + {1 \over 2}{I_2}\omega _2^2$$

$${k_f} = {1 \over 2}({I_1} + {I_2}){\omega ^2}$$

$${k_i} - {k_f} = {1 \over 2}\left[ {{I_1}\omega _1^2 + {I_2}\omega _2^2 - {{{{({I_1}{\omega _1} + {I_2}{\omega _2})}^2}} \over {{I_1} + {I_2}}}} \right]$$

Solving above we get

$${k_i} - {k_f} = {1 \over 2}\left( {{{{I_1}{I_2}} \over {{I_1} + {I_2}}}} \right){({\omega _1} - {\omega _2})^2}$$

questions.subject: physics
questions.content: Three capacitors C1 = 2$$\mu$$F, C2 = 6$$\mu$$F and C3 = 12$$\mu$$F are connected as shown in figure. Find the ratio of the charges on capacitors C1, C2 and C3 respectively :
questions.explanation:
(VD $$-$$ V) C2 + (VD $$-$$ 0) C3 = 0

(VD $$-$$ V) 6 + (VD $$-$$ 0) 12 = 0

VD $$-$$ V + 2VD = 0

VD = $${V \over 3}$$

q2 = (V $$-$$ VD) C2 = $$\left( {V - {V \over 3}} \right)$$ (6 $$\mu$$F)

q2 = (4V) $$\mu$$F

q3 = (VD $$-$$ 0) C3 = $${{V \over 3}}$$ $$\times$$ 12$$\mu$$F = 4V$$\mu$$F

q1 = (V $$-$$ 0) C1 = V(2$$\mu$$F)

q1 : q2 : q3 = 2 : 4 : 4

q1 : q2 : q3 = 1 : 2 : 2

questions.subject: physics
questions.content: if the rms speed of oxygen molecules at 0$$^\circ$$C is 160 m/s, find the rms speed of hydrogen molecules at 0$$^\circ$$C.

questions.subject: physics
questions.content: A constant magnetic field of 1T is applied in the x > 0 region. A metallic circular ring of radius 1m is moving with a constant velocity of 1 m/s along the x-axis. At t = 0s, the centre of O of the ring is at x = $$-$$1m. What will be the value of the induced emf in the ring at t = 1s? (Assume the velocity of the ring does not change.)
questions.explanation:
emf = BLV

= 1 . (2R) . 1

= 2V

questions.subject: physics
questions.content: A mass of 50 kg is placed at the centre of a uniform spherical shell of mass 100 kg and radius 50 m. If the gravitational potential at a point, 25 m from the centre is V kg/m. The value of V is :
questions.explanation:
$${V_A} = \left[ { - {{G{M_1}} \over r} - {{G{M_2}} \over R}} \right]$$

$$ = \left[ { - {{50} \over {25}}G - {{100} \over {50}}G} \right]$$

$$ = - 4G$$

questions.subject: physics
questions.content: For full scale deflection of total 50 divisions, 50 mV voltage is required in galvanometer. The resistance of galvanometer if its current sensitivity is 2 div/mA will be :
questions.explanation:
$${I_{\max }} = {{50} \over 2} = 25$$ mA

$$R = {V \over I} = {{50mV} \over {25mA}} = 2\Omega $$

questions.subject: physics
questions.content: A monochromatic neon lamp with wavelength of 670.5 nm illuminates a photo-sensitive material which has a stopping voltage of 0.48 V. What will be the stopping voltage if the source light is changed with another source of wavelength of 474.6 nm?

questions.subject: physics
questions.content:
Match List - I with List - II.

List - I List - II
(a) $${R_H}$$ (Rydberg constant) (i) $$kg\,{m^{ - 1}}{s^{ - 1}}$$
(b) h (Planck's constant) (ii) $$kg\,{m^2}{s^{ - 1}}$$
(c) $${\mu _B}$$ (Magnetic field energy density) (iii) $$\,{m^{ - 1}}$$
(d) $$\eta $$ (coefficient of viscocity) (iv) $$kg\,{m^{ - 1}}{s^{ - 2}}$$


Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :
questions.explanation:
SI unit of Rydberg const. = m$$-$$1

SI unit of Plank's const. = kg m2s$$-$$1

SI unit of Magnetic field energy density = kg m$$-$$1s$$-$$2

SI unit of coeff. of viscosity = kg m$$-$$1s$$-$$1

questions.subject: physics
questions.content: If force (F), length (L) and time (T) are taken as the fundamental quantities. Then what will be the dimension of density :

questions.subject: physics
questions.content: A coaxial cable consists of an inner wire of radius 'a' surrounded by an outer shell of inner and outer radii 'b' and 'c' respectively. The inner wire carries an electric current i<sub>0</sub>, which is distributed uniformly across cross-sectional area. The outer shell carries an equal current in opposite direction and distributed uniformly. What will be the ratio of the magnetic field at a distance x from the axis when (i) x < a and (ii) a < x < b ?
questions.explanation:
when x < a

$${B_1}(2\pi x) = {\mu _0}\left( {{{{i_0}} \over {\pi {a^2}}}} \right)\pi {x^2}$$

$$B(2\pi x) = {{{\mu _0}{i_0}{x^2}} \over {{a^2}}}$$

$${B_1} = {{{\mu _0}{i_0}x} \over {2\pi {a^2}}}$$ .... (1)

when a < x < b

$${B_2}(2\pi x) = {\mu _0}{i_0}$$

$${B_2} = {{{\mu _0}{i_0}} \over {2\pi x}}$$ ..... (2)

$${{{B_1}} \over {{B_2}}} = {{{\mu _0}{i_0}{x \over {2\pi {a^2}}}} \over {{{{\mu _0}{i_0}} \over {2\pi x}}}} = {{{x^2}} \over {{a^2}}}$$

questions.subject: physics
questions.content:
The height of victoria falls is 63 m. What is the difference in temperature of water at the top and at the bottom of fall?

[Given 1 cal = 4.2 J and specific heat of water = 1 cal g$$-$$1 $$^\circ$$0C$$-$$1]
questions.explanation:
Change in P.E. = Heat energy

mgh = mS$$\Delta$$T

$$\Delta$$T = $${{gh} \over S}$$

= $${{10 \times 63} \over {4200J/kgC}}$$

= 0.147$$^\circ$$C

questions.subject: physics
questions.content: A player kicks a football with an initial speed of 25 ms<sup>$$-$$1</sup> at an angle of 45$$^\circ$$ from the ground. What are the maximum height and the time taken by the football to reach at the highest point during motion ? (Take g = 10 ms<sup>$$-$$2</sup>)

questions.subject: physics
questions.content: The light waves from two coherent sources have same intensity I<sub>1</sub> = I<sub>2</sub> = I<sub>0</sub>. In interference pattern the intensity of light at minima is zero. What will be the intensity of light at maxima?
questions.explanation:
$${I_{\max }} = {\left( {\sqrt {{I_1}} + \sqrt {{I_2}} } \right)^2}$$

= 4 I0

questions.subject: physics
questions.content: Figure shows a rod AB, which is bent in a 120$$^\circ$$ circular arc of radius R. A charge ($$-$$Q) is uniformly distributed over rod AB. What is the electric field $$\overrightarrow E $$ at the centre of curvature O ?
questions.explanation:
$$\varepsilon = {{2k\lambda } \over R}\sin \left( {{\theta \over 2}} \right)( - \widehat i)$$

$$\lambda = \left( {{{ - Q} \over {R\theta }}} \right) = \left( {{{ - Q} \over {R.{{2\pi } \over 3}}}} \right)$$

$$\lambda = {{ - 3Q} \over {2\pi R}}$$

$$\varepsilon = {{2k} \over R}.{{ - 3Q} \over {2\pi R}}.\sin (60^\circ )( - \widehat i)$$

$$\varepsilon = {{3\sqrt 3 Q} \over {8{\pi ^2}{\varepsilon _0}{R^2}}}( + \widehat i)$$

questions.subject: physics
questions.content: Two simple harmonic motion, are represented by the equations $${y_1} = 10\sin \left( {3\pi t + {\pi  \over 3}} \right)$$ $${y_2} = 5(\sin 3\pi t + \sqrt 3 \cos 3\pi t)$$ Ratio of amplitude of y<sub>1</sub> to y<sub>2</sub> = x : 1. The value of x is ______________.
questions.explanation:
$${y_1} = 10\sin \left( {3\pi t + {\pi \over 3}} \right)$$ $$\Rightarrow$$ Amplitude = 10

$${y_2} = 5(\sin 3\pi t + \sqrt 3 \cos 3\pi t)$$

$${y_2} = 10\left( {{1 \over 2}\sin 3\pi t + {{\sqrt 3 } \over 2}\cos 3\pi t} \right)$$

$${y_2} = 10\left( {\cos {\pi \over 3}\sin 3\pi t + \sin {\pi \over 3}\cos 3\pi t} \right)$$

$${y_2} = 10\left( {3\pi t + {\pi \over 3}} \right)$$ $$\Rightarrow$$ Amplitude = 10

So ratio of amplitudes = $${{10} \over {10}}$$ = 1

questions.subject: physics
questions.content: X different wavelengths may be observed in the spectrum from a hydrogen sample if the atoms are exited to states with principal quantum number n = 6 ? The value of X is ______________.
questions.explanation:
No. of different wavelengths = $${{n(n - 1)} \over 2}$$

$$ = {{6 \times (6 - 1)} \over 2} = {{6 \times 5} \over 2} = 15$$

questions.subject: physics
questions.content: A zener diode of power rating 2W is to be used as a voltage regulator. If the zener diode has a breakdown of 10 V and it has to regulate voltage fluctuated between 6 V and 14 V, the value of Rs for safe operation should be ___________ $$\Omega$$.
questions.explanation:
When unregulated voltage is 14 V voltage across zener diode must be 10 V. So potential difference across resistor $$\Delta$$VRs = 4V

and Pzener = 2W

VI = 2

I = $${2 \over {10}}$$ = 0.2 A

$$\Delta$$VRs = I Rs

4 $$\times$$ 0.2 Rs $$\Rightarrow$$ Rs = $${40 \over {2}}$$ = 20$$\Omega$$

questions.subject: physics
questions.content: Wires W1 and W2 are made of same material having the breaking stress of 1.25 $$\times$$ 109 N/m2. W1 and W2 have cross-sectional area of 8 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$7 m2 and 4 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$7 m2, respectively. Masses of 20 kg and 10 kg hang from them as shown in the figure. The maximum mass that can be placed in the pan without breaking the wires is ____________ kg. (Use g = 10 m/s2)

questions.subject: physics
questions.content: A bullet of 10 g, moving with velocity v, collides head-on with the stationary bob of a pendulum and recoils with velocity 100 m/s. The length of the pendulum is 0.5 m and mass of the bob is 1 kg. The minimum value of v = ____________ m/s so that the pendulum describes a circle. (Assume the string to be inextensible and g = 10 m/s2)
questions.explanation:
$$V' = \sqrt {5gR} = \sqrt {5 \times 10 \times 0.5} $$

V' = 5 m/s

m1 V = m2 $$\times$$ 5 $$-$$ m1 $$\times$$ 100

$${{10} \over {1000}} \times V = 5 - {{10} \over {1000}} \times 100$$

V = 400 m/s

questions.subject: physics
questions.content: An ac circuit has an inductor and a resistor resistance R in series, such that X<sub>L</sub> = 3R. Now, a capacitor is added in series such that X<sub>C</sub> = 2R. The ratio of new power factor with the old power factor of the circuit is $$\sqrt 5 :x$$. The value of x is ___________.
questions.explanation:
$$\cos \phi = {R \over {\sqrt {{R^2} + 3{R^2}} }}$$

$$ = {1 \over {\sqrt {10} }}$$

$$\cos \phi ' = {R \over {\sqrt {{R^2} + {R^2}} }}$$

$$ = {1 \over {\sqrt 2 }}$$

$${{\cos \phi '} \over {\cos \phi }} = {{\sqrt {10} } \over {\sqrt 2 }} = {{\sqrt 5 } \over 1}$$

$$\therefore$$ x = 1

questions.subject: physics
questions.content: The ratio of the equivalent resistance of the network (shown in figure) between the points a and b when switch is open and switch is closed is x : 8. The value of x is ___________.
questions.explanation:
$${R_{eq\,open}} = {{3R} \over 2}$$

$${R_{eq\,closed}} = 2 \times {{R \times 2R} \over {3R}} = {{4R} \over 3}$$

$${{{R_{eq\,open}}} \over {{R_{eq\,closed}}}} = {{3R} \over 2} \times {3 \over {4R}} = {9 \over 8}$$

$$\therefore$$ $$x = 9$$

questions.subject: physics
questions.content: A plane electromagnetic wave with frequency of 30 MHz travels in free space. At particular point in space and time, electric field is 6 V/m. The magnetic field at this point will be x $$\times$$ 10<sup>$$-$$8</sup> T. The value of x is ___________.
questions.explanation:
$$|B|\, = {{|E|} \over C} = {6 \over {3 \times {{10}^8}}}$$

= 2 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$8 T

$$\therefore$$ x = 2

questions.subject: physics
questions.content: A tuning fork is vibrating at 250 Hz. The length of the shortest closed organ pipe that will resonate with the tuning fork will be __________ cm. (Take speed of sound in air as 340 ms<sup>$$-$$1</sup>)
questions.explanation:
$${\lambda \over 4}$$ = l $$\Rightarrow$$ $$\lambda$$ = 4l

f = $${V \over \lambda } = {V \over {4l}}$$

$$\Rightarrow$$ 250 = $${{340} \over {4l}}$$

$$\Rightarrow$$ l = $${{34} \over {4 \times 25}}$$ = 0.34 m

l = 34 cm
